PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The absorption maxima ( λ max ) of the film are located at 403 and 589 nm.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| absorption maxima |
| λ max |

The two entities identified as "Property Name" in the paragraph are "absorption maxima" and "λ max". "Absorption maxima" refers to the wavelengths at which a substance absorbs light most strongly, and "λ max" is the specific wavelength at which this maximum absorption occurs.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| absorption maxima |

After reviewing the entities identified in the previous response, only "absorption maxima" clearly refers to a material property. "λ max" is a specific value associated with the absorption maxima, but it is not a material property in and of itself. Therefore, the valid entity to present as a "Property Name" is "absorption maxima".
